trans-unit.source: Generates object context and entity classes (object layer code) from conceptual schema definition language (CSDL) files.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Data.Entity.Design.EntityClassGenerator"></xref> class with a <xref href="System.Data.Entity.Design.LanguageOption"></xref> language option.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Data.Entity.Design.EntityClassGenerator"></xref> class with the specified <xref href="System.Data.Entity.Design.LanguageOption"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Data.Entity.Design.LanguageOption"></xref> value that specifies the language of the generated code.
The default language is C#.
Gets an <xref href="System.Data.Entity.Design.EdmToObjectNamespaceMap"></xref> that contains the conceptual schema definition language (CSDL) to code namespace mappings.
Namespace mappings can be used to specify a different code namespace for generating code than what is specified in the CSDL file.
The namespace mappings are consulted when a reference to a type is to be generated.
If an entry is found, the value will be used to generate the qualified reference to the type; otherwise, the CSDL namespace will be used.
The CSDL to code namespace mappings.
Generates a source code file that contains the objects that were generated from the specified conceptual schema definition language (CSDL) file.
The CSDL file path.
The generated source code file path.
An <xref:System.Collections.IList> of <xref href="System.Data.Metadata.Edm.EdmSchemaError"></xref> that contains any generated errors.

Generates source code using the conceptual schema definition language (CSDL) file contained in the <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader> object and outputs the generated source code to a <xref:System.IO.TextWriter>.
An <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader> that contains the CSDL file.
The <xref:System.IO.TextWriter> to which the source code is written.
An <xref:System.Collections.IList> of <xref href="System.Data.Metadata.Edm.EdmSchemaError"></xref> that contains any generated errors.
Generates source code using the specified conceptual schema definition language (CSDL) file.
The list of schema file paths is used to resolve any references contained in the CSDL file.
The CSDL file path.
The generated source code file path.
A list of schema file paths that can be used to resolve any references in the source schema (the CSDL file).
If the source schema does not have any dependencies, pass in an empty list.
An <xref:System.Collections.IList> of <xref href="System.Data.Metadata.Edm.EdmSchemaError"></xref> objects that contains any generated errors.

Generates source code based on the conceptual schema definition language (CSDL) file in the <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader> object, then outputs the generated source code to a <xref:System.IO.TextWriter>.
An <xref:System.Collections.IList> of <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader> objects is used to resolve any references that are contained in the CSDL file.
An <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader> that contains the CSDL file.
The <xref:System.IO.TextWriter> to which you want to output the generated source code.
The list of <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader> objects that contain schemas that are referenced by the source schema (the CSDL file).
If the source schema does not have any dependencies, pass in an empty <xref:System.Collections.IList> object.
A list of <xref href="System.Data.Metadata.Edm.EdmSchemaError"></xref> objects that contains any generated errors.
Gets or sets a <xref href="System.Data.Entity.Design.LanguageOption"></xref> value that indicates the language of the generated code.
One of the <xref href="System.Data.Entity.Design.LanguageOption"></xref> values.
The default is <xref href="System.Data.Entity.Design.LanguageOption"></xref>.
Occurs when a property has changed.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [NIB: Raising an Event](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/f2adaf01-1ed1-42e1-8c31-8d467e7e0ee2).
To be added.
Occurs when type information has changed.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [NIB: Raising an Event](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/f2adaf01-1ed1-42e1-8c31-8d467e7e0ee2).
To be added.
